intro: Neobotrydium ambrosioides, commonly known as the giant nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other members like common nettles. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and long, hairy stems that can grow up to several meters in height. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically greenish-white in color. Neobotrydium ambrosioides is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
